refnamediv.refpurpose: Deletes an entry from the Authentication Database

refsect1.title: Synopsis
refsect1.para: kas delete -name <name of user> [-admin_username <admin principal to use for authentication>] [-password_for_admin <admin password>] [-cell <cell name>] [-servers <explicit list of authentication servers>+] [-noauth] [-help]
kas d -na <name of user> [-a <admin principal to use for authentication>] [-p <admin password>] [-c <cell name>] [-s <explicit list of authentication servers>+] [-no] [-h]
kas rm -na <name of user> [-a <admin principal to use for authentication>] [-p <admin password>] [-c <cell name>] [-s <explicit list of authentication servers>+] [-no] [-h]

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The kas delete command removes from the Authentication Database the user entry named by the -name argument. The indicated user becomes unable to log in, or the indicated server becomes unreachable (because the Authentication Server's Ticket Granting Service module no longer has a key with which to seal tickets for the server).

listitem.para: Names the Authentication Database entry to delete.
Specifies the user identity under which to authenticate with the Authentication Server for execution of the command. For more details, see kas(8).
Specifies the password of the command's issuer. If it is omitted (as recommended), the kas command interpreter prompts for it and does not echo it visibly. For more details, see kas(8).
Names the cell in which to run the command. For more details, see kas(8).
Names each machine running an Authentication Server with which to establish a connection. For more details, see kas(8).
Assigns the unprivileged identity anonymous to the issuer. For more details, see kas(8).
Prints the online help for this command. All other valid options are ignored.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following example shows the administrative user admin entering interactive mode to delete three accounts.
refsect1.programlisting: % kas Password for admin: ka> delete smith ka> delete pat ka> delete terry

refsect1.title: Privilege Required
refsect1.para: The issuer must have the ADMIN flag set on his or her Authentication Database entry.
